title: South Africa's 'Bomb Squad' primed for detonation in World Cup final
text:
The first time South Africa’s “Bomb Squad” were mentioned at this World Cup, their existence threatened to torpedo the entire team.

A short clip, taken from the end of the pool-stage win over Italy, appeared to show a group of six white South African players purposely excluding Makazole Mapimpi, a black player, from their huddle. It quickly went viral on social media.

As allegations of racism erupted, Mapimpi and Rassie Erasmus, South Africa’s head coach, both came out strongly in defence of the players.

The “Bomb Squad”, they explained, was simply the name the Springboks have given to the group of replacement forwards who come on at the end of every game to blow tiring opponents away.
